definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
lit. the stove fire has turned bright green (allusion to Daoist alchemy) (idiom)/fig. (of an art, a technique etc) brought to the point of perfection

sentences.english: He stood, huddled by the open fire, gazing at the dying embers.
sentences.chinese: 他只是木然地站在爐火旁，看着那漸漸滅去的灰燼。

sentences.english: The firelight danced over her face, over the steep lines of her cheekbones.
sentences.chinese: 爐火在她的臉龐上跳動，照射出她高高的顴骨的線條。

sentences.english: As I sat there in the silence, the fire grew larger.
sentences.chinese: 我坐在這片寂靜中，爐火漸漸旺起來。

sentences.english: 'Where's Mr. Badger?' inquired the Mole, as he warmed the coffee-pot before the fire.
sentences.chinese: “獾先生上哪去了？”鼴鼠問，他正在爐火上溫咖啡。

sentences.english: The fire was warm, however, and the nursery dimly lit by three night-lights, and presently the sewing lay on Mrs.
sentences.chinese: 爐火暖融融的，育兒室裏半明半暗地點着三盞夜燈。

sentences.english: You picture the family by the fire, the student lighting and relighting his pipe.
sentences.chinese: 想到圍坐在爐火旁的一家人，一個不斷點菸斗的學者。

sentences.english: I imagine warming my feet near the fire.
sentences.chinese: 我能想像出在爐火邊暖腳的樣子。

sentences.english: She said the fire’d go out and her jars would break .
sentences.chinese: 她說爐火會熄滅的，她的罐子就會凍破。

sentences.english: Turn off the stove! The water is boiling over .
sentences.chinese: 快關上爐火，水已經滾到滿出來了。

sentences.english: They bunched around the fire for warmth.
The cat got her tail singed through sitting too near the fire.
sentences.chinese: 貓坐得太靠近爐火，尾巴上的毛被烤焦了。

sentences.english: We eat chicken wings and sit by the fire.
sentences.chinese: 我們圍坐在爐火邊喫着雞翅。

sentences.english: She turned from the fire to look at him.
sentences.chinese: 她從爐火那邊轉過身看着他說。

sentences.english: The fire had crumbled down to greyness, and one of the lamps made a gurgling appeal for attention.
sentences.chinese: 爐火已經暗淡，一盞燈咯咯響着請求關照。

sentences.english: He is always checking the stove fire every night in case of carbon monoxide poisoning.
sentences.chinese: 巴立卓每晚檢查爐火，以防煤氣中毒。

sentences.english: He refined the whole art of shuttle diplomacy.
sentences.chinese: 他把穿梭外交藝術發展到爐火純青的地步。

definition: to ignite/to light a fire/to agitate/to start an engine/ignition/fig. to stir up trouble
to manufacture charcoal/to burn charcoal (often a reference to suicide by carbon monoxide poisoning)
to discharge smoke/to fume with rage
to stop burning/to go out (of fire)/to die out/extinguished
